attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2023-1191

Date: 2023-12-05

   The Committee of the Privy Council has had before it a report from the Right Honourable Justin P.J. Trudeau, the Prime Minister, stating that by Commission dated the 7th day of August, 2015, the Honourable J. Michel Doyon, K.C., was appointed Lieutenant Governor of the Province of Quebec, and

 

   That the said Honourable J. Michel Doyon, K.C., made and subscribed the Oaths of Allegiance and Office prescribed by section 61 of the Constitution Act, 1867 and assumed the duties of the said office on the 24th day of September, 2015.

 

   The Committee, therefore, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, advises that a Commission under the Great Seal of Canada do issue appointing Manon Jeannotte, of Saint-Lin-Laurentides, in the Province of Quebec, to be Lieutenant Governor of the Province of Quebec, and that, from the date on which the said Manon Jeannotte, makes and subscribes the Oaths of Allegiance and Office prescribed by section 61 of the Constitution Act, 1867, the Commission issued hereunder shall supersede the Commission appointing the Honourable J. Michel Doyon, K.C., to be Lieutenant Governor of the said Province.

 


   Le très honorable Justin P.J. Trudeau, premier ministre, avait présenté au Comité du Conseil privé un rapport déclarant que l’honorable J. Michel Doyon, c.r., était nommé lieutenant-gouverneur de la province de Québec, en vertu d’une commission datée du 7 août 2015;

 

   Que ledit honorable J. Michel Doyon, c.r., a prêté et souscrit les serments d’allégeance et d’office prévus à l’article 61 de la Loi constitutionnelle de 1867 et a assumé les fonctions de cette charge le 24 septembre 2015.

 

   À ces causes, sur recommandation du premier ministre, le Comité recommande qu’une commission sous le grand sceau du Canada soit émise nommant Manon Jeannotte, de Saint-Lin-Laurentides (Québec), lieutenante-gouverneure de la province de Québec, et ce, à compter de la date à laquelle ladite Manon Jeannotte prêtera et souscrira les serments d’allégeance et d’office prévus à l’article 61 de la Loi constitutionnelle de 1867, la commission émise en vertu de la présente remplacera celle qui nommait l’honorable J. Michel Doyon, c.r., au poste de lieutenant-gouverneur de ladite province.

PC Number: 2023-1191Date: 2023-12-05


	 	 The Committee of the Privy Council has had before it a report from the Right Honourable Justin P.J. Trudeau, the Prime Minister, stating that by Commission dated the 7th day of August, 2015, the Honourable J. Michel Doyon, K.C., was appointed Lieutenant Governor of the Province of Quebec, and

 

	 	 That the said Honourable J. Michel Doyon, K.C., made and subscribed the Oaths of Allegiance and Office prescribed by section 61 of the Constitution Act, 1867 and assumed the duties of the said office on the 24th day of September, 2015.

 

	 	 The Committee, therefore, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, advises that a Commission under the Great Seal of Canada do issue appointing Manon Jeannotte, of Saint-Lin-Laurentides, in the Province of Quebec, to be Lieutenant Governor of the Province of Quebec, and that, from the date on which the said Manon Jeannotte, makes and subscribes the Oaths of Allegiance and Office prescribed by section 61 of the Constitution Act, 1867, the Commission issued hereunder shall supersede the Commission appointing the Honourable J. 	 	 À ces causes, sur recommandation du premier ministre, le Comité recommande qu’une commission sous le grand sceau du Canada soit émise nommant Manon Jeannotte, de Saint-Lin-Laurentides (Québec), lieutenante-gouverneure de la province de Québec, et ce, à compter de la date à laquelle ladite Manon Jeannotte prêtera et souscrira les serments d’allégeance et d’office prévus à l’article 61 de la Loi constitutionnelle de 1867, la commission émise en vertu de la présente remplacera celle qui nommait l’honorable J.
